intro: Zuckertia cordata, commonly known as the slender-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands. Zuckertia cordata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
